SUMMARY: QseB, quorum-sensing E. coli regulator B , is response regulator component of QseB-QseC two-component system, which is one component of quorum-sensing regulatory cascade involved in positive regulation of flagella and motility genes by activating transcription of flhDC, an operon that encodes master regulator of se genes [11929534]. This protein also may have an undetermined role in metal metabolism, because qseBC deletion mutants show hypersensitivity to several toxic cations [12897016]. QseB and QseC of enterohemorrhagic E. coli (EHEC) and of E. coli K-12 are almost identical; re are only three amino acid differences in QseB and only eight amino acid differences in QseC between se strains [11929534]. It was demonstrated in EHEC that QseC directly senses and binds bacterial hormone-like AI-3 signal and host epineprhine/norepineprhine hormones, and it causes autophosphorylation of QseC, which n transfers phosphate group to QseB to activate it [16803956]. expression of operon containing both genes qseB, encoding response regulator, and qseC, encoding sensor kinase, is regulated by a quorum-sensing system [11929534], and regulatory region of operon is 99.6% identical to regulatory region of same operon in EHEC [16194231].
